Justification for Mapping: Needed to retain to provide context for the content of $a; not possible to link or apply to the  portion of the manifestation or item referenced from data in the MARC, so add as a parentetical phrase at end of note text ($a),   ; lna 2022-10-28
Transformation Notes:
The $a mapping could vary (either note on manifestation or note on item, depending on presence of $5).  
As with other unstructured text string notes, the materials specified could be appended to the end of the note text (subfield a mapping) in parentheses with the prefix Applies to, e.g. (Applies to: booklet) ; lna 2022-05-17
Problems with Mapping: Because $3 is unstructured, we don't have enough data to relate this note to a specific part of a manifestation or item.
Notes (Uncategorized): loss of separation of the part specification (not a big impact?)

Justification for Mapping: $5 provides the local, copy-specific context for the note.
Transformation Notes: See example $5 mapping at decision : https://github.com/uwlib-cams/MARC2RDA/wiki/Decisions-Index#iij-5  . The minted item URI relates as a holding to a manifestation (minted IRI)of a collection, with appellation "Collection of [named organization assigned the code in MARC Code List for Organizations]". This manifestation "manifests" (shortcut) a work (minted IRI, collection, WEMI lock) which has a collector corporate body (minted IRI), This corporate body has an identifier for agent that is a Nomen, (minted IRI) with an identifier for agent that is a text string, content of $5, and scheme of nomen provided as a string of the URL for the MARC Code List for Organizations.
Problems with Mapping: This mapping generates a different item URI for each field containing a $5 in order to  establish a relatinship with manifestation and apply notes or other relations according to the field content. The result may easily have redundant item IRIs when only a single item exists, since practice at many institutions results in $5 in multiple fields in description of rare materials or archives.  Data in MARC is not sufficient to identify specific items or relate item data from different parts of the reccord with specific generated IRI identifiers. Item data may thus require manual reconciliation after conversion, depending on the institution's needs.
Notes (Uncategorized): See Subfield 5 discussion https://github.com/uwlib-cams/MARC2RDA/discussions/361  No characteristics can be supplied for the item or association with specifric identifiers based on this subfield. General description from MARC21 Appendix A, MARC Format Bibliographic:  MARC code of the institution or organization that holds the copy to which the data in the field applies.  ; lna 10-28-2022

Transformation Notes:
If $5 is present, generate item IRI and treat note as note on item (see $5 mapping)

Append before the $a text in the note, the prefix "Exhibition note: "
Notes (Uncategorized):
"Discussion at https://github.com/uwlib-cams/MARC2RDA/discussions/361  
" 
See aso $3 mapping for appending a suffix if it is present.

Justification for Mapping: Marc field defined as "Copy-specific" but without an institution to which we can ascribe the item,  it does not seem worthwhile to create one just for this note.  Appending "Item " before the "exhibited" prefix to the note is sufficient to indicate that the note relates to an item.
Transformation Notes: Append before the $a text in the note, the prefix "Exhibition note: "
Notes (Uncategorized): See aso $3 mapping for appending a suffix if it is present.
